solution_line_template: First find the number of Best Buy gift cards Jack needs to return: {bestbuy_total_cards} cards - {bestbuy_sent_cards} cards = <<{bestbuy_total_cards}-{bestbuy_sent_cards}={bestbuy_remaining_cards}>>{bestbuy_remaining_cards} cards

Then multiply that number by the cost per card to find the total refund Jack gets from Best Buy: {bestbuy_remaining_cards} cards * ${bestbuy_card_value}/card = $<<{bestbuy_remaining_cards}*{bestbuy_card_value}={bestbuy_refund}>>{bestbuy_refund}

Then find the number of Walmart gift cards Jack needs to return: {walmart_total_cards} cards - {walmart_sent_cards} cards = <<{walmart_total_cards}-{walmart_sent_cards}={walmart_remaining_cards}>>{walmart_remaining_cards} cards

Then multiply that number by the cost per card to find the total refund Jack gets from Walmart: {walmart_remaining_cards} cards * ${walmart_card_value}/card = $<<{walmart_remaining_cards}*{walmart_card_value}={walmart_refund}>>{walmart_refund}
Then add the two refunds to find his total refund amount: ${bestbuy_refund} + ${walmart_refund} = $<<{bestbuy_refund}+{walmart_refund}={total_refund}>>{total_refund}
